definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to dislike/suspicion/resentment/enmity/abbr. for 嫌犯[xian2 fan4], criminal suspect

sentences.english: I'm frustrated that my co-workers are so annoying.
sentences.chinese: 我的同事们真是讨人嫌，让我真沮丧。

sentences.english: Guests and fish stink within three days.
sentences.chinese: 鱼放三天会发臭，客呆三天讨人嫌。

sentences.english: He is always making some annoying remarks, which is why all of us don't like him.
sentences.chinese: 他总说一些讨人嫌的话，大家都不喜欢他。

sentences.english: I hope he won't be a bore.
sentences.chinese: 挺让人不舒服的，希望他不要讨人嫌。

sentences.english: In short, you make yourself as unpleasant as possible.
sentences.chinese: 总之，你得尽可能让自己讨人嫌。

sentences.english: People who park on the pavement are a public nuisance.
sentences.chinese: 把汽车停在人行道上的人很讨人嫌。

definition: (old) girl trafficked into a brothel to work as prostitute
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
erhua variant of 缺心眼[que1 xin1 yan3]
